channel.title: etymology on Today I Learned
channel.description: Recent content in etymology on Today I Learned

item.description: About the precedent for deriving serde from serialize/deserialize: A codec is a device or computer program that encodes or decodes a data stream or signal. Codec is a portmanteau of coder/decoder. In electronic communications, an endec is a device that acts as both an encoder and a decoder on a signal or data stream, and hence is a type of codec. Endec is a portmanteau of encoder/decoder. – https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Codec

Bayer and McCreight never explained what, if anything, the B stands for: Boeing, balanced, between, broad, bushy, and Bayer have been suggested. McCreight has said that “the more you think about what the B in B-trees means, the better you understand B-trees.” – https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B-tree#History
